line_1: That while she doats and dreams that she believes,
line_2: She mocks her maker and herself deceives,

line_1: Each thinks Alcestes as himself believes,
line_2: And thus the intermediate time deceives.

line_1: And much She suffers, as She much believes.
line_2: Not soon provok'd, She easily forgives;

line_1: There the fool'd atheist, tho' too late, believes:
Who feeds on Faith, and, as the Church, believes;
line_2: Happy, alone, that thoughtless Mortal lives,

line_1: Tho' in his heart he weel believes,
The Youth, who all the soft Distress believes,
line_2: Soon wants the kind Compassion which he gives.
Pleas'd, when his Reason He deceives;

line_1: They were what base credulity believes
line_2: True Christians are, dissemblers, drunkards, thieves.
